info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:23AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog Expected Through the Early Morning Hours... Across the Higher Terrain of the Blue Ridge... A very moist atmosphere and light easterly flow has resulted in widespread low clouds across the region early this morning. These low clouds are intersecting the higher terrain of the Blue Ridge resulting in areas of dense fog. Visibility may be reduced to near 0 miles at elevations above 2500 ft. throughout much of the morning. In addition, patchy dense fog has developed at lower elevations as well across the foothills and piedmont areas of North Carolina and Virginia as well as into the Roanoke Valley and the New River Valley. Please use extreme caution if you plan to travel throughout the higher terrain of the Blue Ridge this morning including areas from Boone, to Jefferson, to Independence, to Fancy Gap, Hillsville, and Floyd. Also be alert for patchy dense fog in other surrounding areas as you travel early this morning. Reduce speed, use low beam headlights, and allow extra time to reach your destination. Some roads and highways that will be impacted with dense fog early this morning include: Interstate 77 through northwest NC and southwest VA, Interstate 81 from mile markers 35 to 180, Much of the Blue Ridge Parkway through northwest NC and southwest VA.
